title: As it happened: West of England - BBC News
summary: police say they have had 10 sightings from the public of missing nurse anna lewis .
snow falls in some parts of the west of england .
the first video of a baby gorilla born at bristol zoo has been released - both doing well .
bath scientists develop technique which could make getting vital medicines to remote areas easier .
council to sign off £ 650,000 study into bristol airport transport links .
live news , sport , weather and travel updates from across the west of england on tuesday 25 april 2017

documents.title: sunny spells with showers for wednesday
text: well that 's all for tonight from us .
we 'll be back with more news , sport , travel and weather tomorrow from 7am .
just time to leave you with tonight 's weather forecast , and it looks like we 're going to get some sunshine and showers on wednesday .
here 's ian fergusson with the details .

documents.title: a look inside the uk 's biggest school uniform wholesalers
text: bet you did n't know the largest british wholesaler for school uniforms is based in trowbridge
blue max banner supplies 10,000 schools and their machines can embroider eight garments at a time .
but how ?
have a little look for some factory magic !

documents.title: travel : m32 partially closed southbound overnight
text: # m32 closed southbound tonight between j2 and j3 to replace central barrier .
diversions on traffic england .

documents.title: flower show could move after more than 150 years
text: it looks like taunton flower show is to move from the site it 's been held at since 1851 .
organisers say they need to find a new venue after taunton deane borough council decided to charge them for the use of vivary park .
the annual show is said to be the oldest event of its kind in britain .
the event 's jim lewis said : `` we understand the council 's financial constraints but it is simply not economic for us to accommodate a five-figure charge within an already tight budget . ''
this year 's show will be held at vivary park as normal , at the beginning of august .

documents.title: missing nurse anna lewis : search continues
text: police have been searching open areas in north and central bristol in the hunt for a student nurse , who has n't been seen for nearly two weeks .
here 's what we know :

documents.title: shoe-perb london marathon run for charity
text: only a few more shoe puns , we promise
he 's a real life superhero from wiltshire .
in fact , he 's shoe-perman
martin pearce completed the london marathon dressed as a shoe .
he did it all to raise money for children 's hos south west and is giving his medal away to one very special girl .

documents.title: mp calls for refugee minister
text: the uk should introduce a minister for refugees , according to a parliamentary group headed by bristol west 's labour mp thangham debonnaire .
an eight-month inquiry says refugees are welcomed well in the uk , but more could be done .
ms debonnaire explained how a new refugee minister could help resolve the current two-tier system .

documents.title: snow ? sunshine ? hail ? who knows in the west today !
text: anyone get caught in this earlier on ?
i know ! !

documents.title: guide dog is airline 's most frequent flyer
text: some dogs are good at catching balls .
this one 's talent is catching planes !
a guide dog from wiltshire has been named as easyjet 's most frequent flyer - after taking his 35th flight .
joey the guide dog mainly flies between london and cyprus with his owner jan gibson from swindon .
she said : `` the crew and passengers often fuss over joey and take photos as it 's not often you get to see a dog on a plane . ''
easyjet does not allow animals on its flights , apart from guide and assistance dogs .
peter duffy from easyjet said : `` with 35 flights under his collar , he must be one of the most travelled dogs in the country . ''
read the full story here .

documents.title: exmoor pony centre could close
text: the trust which runs the exmoor pony centre near dulverton says it needs £ 20,000 to keep going .
the centre promotes and protects the animals which roam freely on the moors .
it opened in 2006 and has attracted more than 50,000 visitors , while some 300 moor-bred foals have been saved .
staff say they will struggle to stay open beyond august if they do n't raise the cash , and have started a fundraising campaign .

documents.title: player cited after gloucester 's rugby euro cup semi final
text: a french rugby player is facing a disciplinary hearing after an incident in the european challenge cup semi-final between gloucester and la rochelle at the weekend .
the cherry and whites ' richard hibbard was allegedly struck by la rochelle 's jone qovu nailiko in 45th minute of the match .
the epcr , the governing body of club rugby in europe , has confirmed it has received a citing complaint , and a disciplinary hearing will take place tomorrow .
gloucester won the game , and will face stade francais in the final at murrayfield on 12 may .

documents.title: snow and hail in the west : another
text: this was the scene in cam , gloucestershire , this afternoon as hail turned the lawns white .
`` roll on summer , '' said john wilkes who sent us the photo .
we agree .
big coat back out again today

documents.title: breakingtour of britain heading for the cotswolds
text: the penultimate stage of the tour of britain will end in the centre of cheltenham , it 's been revealed .
some of the world 's top professional cyclists will race through the cotswolds on saturday 9th september - for the 7th stage of the race .
en route they 'll take in bourton-on-the-water , stow-on-the-wold , moreton-in-marsh and winchcombe , and a king of the mountains climb on cleeve hill .
you can get full details on the tour of britain website .

documents.title: vixens ' boss aims for ashton gate return
text: head coach willie kirk wants bristol city women to play more games at ashton gate , after playing there on saturday for their first league match of 2017 in a rare double header with city 's men .
kirk 's vixens lost 3-1 to reading in women 's super league one summer series , kicking off an hour after the end of bristol city and barnsley 's championship meeting .
click here to read the full story .

documents.title: missing nurse latest : why the police are so worried
text: police have been explaining why they are becoming concerned for the welfare of a student nurse from bristol , who went missing earlier this month .
specialist officers are searching open areas in north and central bristol in the hunt for anna lewis , 27 , was last seen on cctv leaving southmead hospital on 13 april .
det insp roger doxsey from .
avon and somerset police explained why they were now becoming worried .

text: you 've been sending us your snow photos on the points west facebook page .
fiona says her kids managed to have a snowball fight in axbridge , somerset .
and mandy sent this photo from weston where more snow has settled .
well - a small dusting , anyway !

documents.title: 'about 10 sightings ' of missing student nurse anna lewis
text: back now to missing student nurse anna lewis .
our reporter scott ellis has been talking to det insp roger doxsey .
he says there have been 10 sightings reported since the campaign began to find her .
anna , 27 , was last seen on cctv leaving southmead hospital on 13 april .
specialist officers are searching open areas in north and central bristol as police continue to hunt for a student nurse who went missing earlier this month .

documents.title: search for missing student nurse : what we know
text: as specialist officers continue to search in north and central bristol , this is what we know so far about missing 27-year-old student nurse anna lewis .

documents.title: local election may 2017 : wiltshire profile
text: everyone 's talking about the snap general election , but do n't forget there are local elections on 4th may .
here 's a whistle-stop tour with bbc political reporter dan o'brien - can you guess which issue is bothering many wiltshire voters ?

documents.title: missing student nurse : family being kept informed of developments
text: anna , 27 , from fishponds in bristol , was last seen on cctv leaving southmead hospital on 13 april .
she was reported missing by her family .
det isnp roger doxsey said : `` we are supporting anna 's parents and are keeping them fully updated on our inquiry as it progresses .
`` we 're also working with uwe bristol and southmead hospital to try and find out as much as we can about anna and her movements in the days before she went missing . ''

documents.title: missing student nurse search to target open areas in bristol
text: a search for a student nurse from bristol , who went missing earlier this month , is targeting open areas in bristol .
anna lewis , 27 , who lives in fishponds , was last seen on cctv leaving southmead hospital on 13 april .
avon and somerset police say specialist officers will be searching in north and central bristol .
det insp roger doxsey said : we 're clearly becoming very worried about anna 's welfare as she has not been in touch with family or friends since wednesday 12 april .
we do n't believe she has her mobile phone or any money or bank cards with her , which is increasing our level of concern . ''
a police press conference is due to be held later this afternoon with more details of the search .

documents.title: 'we 'll keep going as long as we can ' : swindon sikhs celebrate a year of feeding the homeless
text: a group of sikhs in their 20s and 30s who serve homeless people with pasta dishes and other meals are celebrating a their first year of operations .
the food is donated by the community and prepared by the volunteers .
they were inspired to take action after the tragic death of a local rough sleeper during cold weather in february 2016 .

documents.title: scything champion teaches traditional techniques
text: scything dates back to 500 bc but recently made a bit of a comeback when actor aidan turner took his shirt off in the bbc 's adaptation of the poldark novels .
now a group has been set up in wellington , somerset , to encourage people to learn how to scythe and take care of the community 's green spaces .
and you 'll be in safe scything hands - the summer meadow group is run by a national scything champion .

documents.title: mohed altrad : greig laidlaw 'disappointed ' premiership blocked gloucester investment
text: club captain greig laidlaw is `` really disappointed '' by the decision to block mohed altrad 's investment in gloucester rfc .
full story here .

documents.title: local election may 2017 : somerset profile
text: everyone 's talking about the snap general election , but do n't forget there are local elections on 4th may .
political reporter ruth bradley went out to ask voters in somerset what they want .

documents.title: bath lib dems react as parliamentary candidate steps down
text: i would like to thank jay risbridger for the integrity he has shown in swiftly reaching his difficult decision and for all his work fighting to prevent the brutal , hard brexit mrs may intends for us .
we look forward to welcoming him on the campaign trail to help us unseat our brexit tory mp and return his liberal democrat successor to parliament to properly represent the people of bath .

documents.title: mum and baby gorilla 'doing well '
text: the first video of a baby gorilla born at bristol zoo has been released .
the western lowland gorilla was born to mum touni and dad jock in the early hours of saturday morning .
touni , who is a first time mum , gave birth inside the gorilla house alongside the rest of the troop and is said to be relaxed , eating and drinking well .
pictures courtesy bristol zoo .

documents.title: stroud mp neil carmichael joins others leaving anti hard brexit group open britain
text: soubry , morgan , grieve and carmichael to leave open britain - wo n't be part of any group campaigning against other tories
disappointing but unsurprising .
if brexit taught us anything , it was 4 tories , party comes first , even before country they profess to love .
that 's the tory party that campaigned for remain ?
two-thirds of them did yet few now opposing extreme brexit .
do they think a pm with massive majority will care about/act upon their views ?
the party in power needs to follow the majority view or resign .
the majority voted for brexit .
we live in a democracy .
euref advisory : 51.8 % brexiters represent 27 % of pop'n .
mps are reps , not delegates & act in best interests of uk , not just 1 group .
it was a 70 % turn out .
larger than a general election .
may wins and path to brexit is clear
that 's not in dispute .
but campaign built on lies to effect irreversible constitutional change on simple majority was flawed .
you ca n't change the constitution of a golf club on less than two-thirds vote .
eu ref was to solve tory infighting , uk interests incidental .
you mean they were told that they had to sign up to the policy mandate , or they would be deselected .
dictator may strikes again
bexit means brexshit follow may or get the f8ck out of the tory party and they all chickened out .
but i 'm sure you 'll spin this
positively for may , instead of calling her out for demanding absolute loyalty .
if corbyn imposed such a dictatorial position
you 'd be in full on snark and denigration mode .
but with may you just report and make no personal snide comments .
she wo n't read this you know
i know , but others will .
as to if they agree or not , with the premise , i leave that up to the individual reader .
constituency voted remain .
mp greg clark backs leave .
disenfranchised by mps .
remainers only option is tactical vote .
16m deserve better
what about the 17 m that voted for brexit ?
they should be ignored ?
and somebody needs to hold the brexit campaign to account for its lies on nhs funding and migration figures
well as @ twitterid points out , we not left eu yet .
no but they have to be held to account during talks or it 's too late & a fait accompli .
prices already rising and jobs going .
just the start
that weakens the hands of those to negotiate .
remain mps will always vote against the deal , whatever it is .
election has to be final mandate
tory remainers wo n't be able to vote what they believe because may will tie them to a manifesto brexit pledge .
hence need for tactical vote
doubt that will happen if may has big majority .
back benches are at their most rebellious when there are large majorities .

documents.title: new technique to transport vaccines to remote areas
text: a new technique allowing vaccines to be transported without refrigeration is being developed at the university of bath .
scientists said it uses 'cages ' , made from silica , which could make getting vital medicines to remote or dangerous areas easier , cheaper and safer .
dr asel sartbaeva said they are also looking at developing the silica into a tablet which would mean people would not need to be injected .
the team from bath now have to find a pharmaceutical company willing to develop their invention .

documents.title: hold on to your hats - here 's the bristol ferry at very high speed
text: wish my phone had n't died here 's the gorge trip at a gazillion mph
that 's so cool !

documents.title: exmoor pony centre 'under threat '
text: the exmoor pony centre has launched a £ 20,000 fundraising campaign in an effort to stay open beyond the end of this summer .
the moorland mousie trust operates the centre , promoting and protecting the animals which roam freely on the moors .
it opened in 2006 and has attracted more than 50,000 visitors , while over 300 moor-bred foals have been saved .

documents.title: scientists develop 'cool ' vaccine technique for hot countries
text: scientists from the university of bath have created a technique which allows vaccines to be transported without refrigeration .
vaccines only work if they are kept at low temperatures - but keeping them cool in hot countries can prove very difficult .
the team from bath said clinical tests mean it will be years before it can be used - and they now need find a pharmaceutical company willing to develop their invention .

documents.title: join the bbc somerset live local election debate
text: the leaders of the four main political groups on somerset county council are taking part in a facebook live debate on bbc somerset ahead of next week 's local elections .
we 've been asking you what you want the parties to focus on .

documents.title: council to sign off £ 650,000 study into bristol airport transport links
text: a £ 650,000 study looking at how to improve transport links to bristol airport is due to be signed off later .
north somerset council is expected to approve the project into how travel to and from the site can be improved .
rail , road , public transport and driverless cars are all options being considered .
most of the money is being provided by bristol airport , with the hope that once the study has identified the best option , funds can be sought from the department for transport .

documents.title: more names could be added to war memorial
text: tewkesbury historical society is running a consultation on new names to be added to the town 's war memorial .
through research they have found more people from the town who they say deserve to take pride of place .
the society 's president john dixon explained why some names might be missing .

documents.title: good morning from bbc local live in the west
text: good morning , this is bbc local live across the west of england .
we 'll be bringing you a full round-up of today 's news , sport , travel and weather until 10pm .
there 's a much more wintry feel to the weather today with showers predicted later .
here 's holly green with the full forecast .
